content: How can I create a simple web page using HTML?

Creating a simple web page using HTML is a great way to get started with web development. Here’s a step-by-step guide to help you create your first web page: 1. **Choose a Code Editor:** - You can use any text editor like Notepad (Windows) or TextEdit (Mac). However, using a code editor like Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text, or Atom can make the process easier and more efficient. 2. **Create a New HTML File:** - Open your code editor and create a new file. Save it with a `.html` extension, such as `index.html`. 3. **Basic HTML Structure:** - Every HTML page starts with a basic structure. Here’s a simple template you can use: ```html My First Web Page

Welcome to My Web Page

This is a simple web page created using HTML.

``` 4. **Understanding the HTML Structure:** - ``: Declares the document type and version of HTML. - ``: The root element of the HTML page with the language attribute set to English. - ``: Contains meta-information about the document, such as the character set and the title. - ``: Sets the title of the web page, which appears in the browser tab. - `<body>`: Contains the content that will be displayed on the web page. - `<h1>`: A heading tag, with `<h1>` being the largest and `<h6>` the smallest. - `<p>`: A paragraph tag for adding text content. 5. **Save and View Your Web Page:** - Save your HTML file and open it using a web browser by double-clicking the file. You should see the text "Welcome to My Web Page" as the heading and "This is a simple web page created using HTML." as a paragraph. 6. **Enhance with More HTML Elements:** - You can add more elements such as images, links, and lists to your web page. - **Image:** ```html <img src="image.jpg" alt="Description of image" width="300"> ``` - **Link:** ```html <a href="https://example.com">Visit Example</a> ``` - **List:** ```html <ul> <li>First item</li> <li>Second item</li> </ul> ``` By following these steps, you can create a simple web page using HTML. As you become more comfortable, you can explore CSS and JavaScript to enhance the appearance and functionality of your web pages.
